triples.name: Microplastics
triples.relevance: The paper investigates how microplastic diversity affects microbial network complexity and stability, proposing novel findings about this environmental contaminant's ecological effects.

triples.name: Microbial ecology
triples.relevance: The paper studies microbial communities in lake sediments, examining how environmental factors affect microbial interactions and network properties.

triples.name: Ecological network
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes microbial ecological networks using measures like connectance and path length to evaluate network structure and complexity.

triples.name: Microcosm (experimental ecosystem)
triples.relevance: The researchers used 600 microcosms as experimental systems to simulate natural lake sediment ecosystems under controlled conditions.

triples.name: Sediment
triples.relevance: Lake sediment was the study environment where microbial communities were sampled and analyzed for network responses to microplastic diversity.

triples.name: Network analysis
triples.relevance: The paper employs network analysis techniques to examine microbial community structure and measure properties like connectance and average path length.

triples.name: Biological interaction
triples.relevance: The paper measures species interactions in microbial networks and analyzes how microplastic diversity and temperature strengthen these interactions.

triples.name: Robustness of complex networks
triples.relevance: The paper uses species extinction simulations to assess network robustness, finding that higher microplastic diversity leads to more stable networks.

triples.name: Biodegradable polymer
triples.relevance: The paper examines how biodegradable microplastics specifically mediate the effects of microplastic diversity on network stability.
